definitions.definition: the area at either side of the body between the top of the leg and the middle part of the body; the joint at the top of the leg that connects it with the top part of the body
definitions.labels: (informal)(formal)(British English)(British English)(disapproving)(both informal, often disapproving)(informal, disapproving)

examples.text: She stood with her hands on her hips.
These jeans are too tight around the hips.
She broke her hip in the fall.
He leaned casually against the door frame, hands on hips.
He put his hands on his hips and sighed.
Her hips were very narrow like a girl's.
Her hips were swaying in time to the music.
My grandmother's having a hip replacement.
She was carrying a baby on her hip.
She was wearing a short blue dress, belted across the hips.
The gun could be fired from the shoulder or from the hip.
Twist your hips in your opponent's direction as you punch.
He had his leg amputated at the hip.

definitions.definition: having hips of the size or shape mentioned
the red fruit that grows on some types of wild rose bush
to react quickly without thinking carefully first

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 2 Old English hype, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heup and German Hüfte, also to hop (verb). noun sense 3 Old English hēope, hīope, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch joop and German Hiefe.
